Info Source: Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2001 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.

Description: Irving Oil Corporation, Irving Oil Terminals Inc., and Global Petroleum Corp. agreed to pay a total of $312,500 into the Natural Resource Damages Trust in settlement of allegations they allowed oil to spill into the Chelsea River from an improperly supervised pipleline at their jointly owned fuel loading dock.

Agency: Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs
Notes: Captured from records in EEA database with basic enforcement information; may not include full details of penalties.
